intro: Onosma sulaimaniaca, commonly known as the Sulaimani Mountain fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iraq and Iran. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Onosma sulaimaniaca is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
